title: Patellar Tendinopathy Rehabilitation
content: Patellar tendinopathy (jumper's knee) involves degenerative changes of the patellar tendon. Treatment centers on eccentric exercise protocols, particularly decline squats. Load management is crucial, with gradual return to sport-specific activities. Adjunct therapies include extracorporeal shock wave therapy and platelet-rich plasma injections for refractory cases. Surgical intervention is rarely needed but may involve debridement of pathological tissue.
